title: Technology Agnostic
description:
Connect any technology. If a technology can send and/or receive data, that means it can be connected to MESG.

Connections can come from any traditional web service, blockchain technology, IoT or private event system that your company might have.

You get it, anything with data can be connected to MESG.

title: Service Oriented
description:
Organize, use and re-use parts of your application into services. Every service will be its own application with its own tasks and events that your application will be able to connect to.

This kind of architecture is interesting because it helps you create flexible applications that are easily maintainable.

title: Event Driven
description:
Imperative programming is so old-school. We want real-time and event-driven applications that are really reactive.

Now, the only business logic you have to write is the description of how you want to execute a specific task.

Your Application is a simple list of when ... and then ...

title: Minimal coding
description:
Building features onto your application is really simple when it’s event-driven and service-oriented. You don't even need any coding skills to create an application.

Imagine a specific workflow, then just describe it in a workflow file and your application is all set and ready to run.

title: Decentralized
description:
Decentralization is more than just a hot topic, it's a new way to create applications where users no longer need to use servers or make sure those servers are running 100% of the time.

With MESG, your application’s services run everywhere, and every part of your application is executed by different actors on the network.
